subject: Philosophy
title: The Evening Review
description: A 60-second lesson on The Evening Review.

hook.text: Before sleep, Seneca asked himself three questions: What did I do wrong? What did I do right? What can I improve?

buildup.text: The evening review is a daily self-audit â€” honest but not punishing.

discovery.text: By reviewing your actions, you spot patterns. You learn which triggers lead to poor responses.

twist.text: Seneca wasn't trying to be perfect. He was trying to be better today than yesterday.

climax.text: This simple practice became the foundation of modern journaling and reflective therapy.

punchline.text: The day isn't over until you've learned from it.

quiz.question: What three questions did Seneca ask himself each evening?
options: What went wrong, what went right, what can improve
Am I rich, famous, and powerful
Did I meditate, exercise, and read
